Total high needs

£1,302,000

Total high needs breakdown
High needs Places Rate Sub-total
16 to 19 students
Places: 143
Rate: £6,000 		143 £6,000 £858,000
19 to 24 students
Places: 74
Rate: £6,000 		74 £6,000 £444,000
Total high needs
Places: 217 		217 £1,302,000
Where place numbers come from

Place numbers are either rolled forward from 2020 to 2021 or your local authority agreed it with ESFA. This provides a base level of funding.

You must agree additional funding above this level with your local authority. Local authorities pay you the top-up funding directly. It is not shown in this statement.

Total high needs

{% if scenario == '2' %} {% else %}
{% if scenario == '1' %}

ESFA is moving to a new methodology to calculate discretionary bursary fund. You received £530,927 in 2019 to 2020. In 2021 to 2022, you will receive at least 75% of that amount (£398,196) and up to 125%.

£234,911 is less than the 75% lower limit. You will receive an adjusted amount of £398,196.

{% elif scenario == '3' %}

ESFA is moving to a new methodology to calculate discretionary bursary fund. You received £530,927 in 2019 to 2020. During the transition, you will receive at least 75% of that amount and up to 125% (£663,659).

£1,384,346 is more than the 125% upper limit. You will receive an adjusted amount of £663,659.

{% else %}

ESFA is moving to a new methodology to calculate discretionary bursary fund. You received £530,927 in 2019 to 2020. During the transition, you will receive at least 75% of that amount and up to 125% (£663,659).

£1,384,346 is more than the 125% upper limit. You will receive an adjusted amount of £663,659.

{% endif %}
{% endif %} {% if scenario == '1' %}
